column4: how do I change the permissions of a folder in the failsafe terminal?
I need it to be 644 and owned by a user called rachael
chmod
sudo chown -R rachel:rachel rachel && sudo chmod -R 644 rachel
make that: sudo chown -R rachel:rachel rachel && sudo chmod 644 rachel
I think I just told you
rachael?  not rachel?  If so, then: chown -R rachael:rachael /home/rachael && chmod -R 644 /home/rachael
what exactly was changed?
then change it back.  sudo mv /home/rachel /home/rachael
I know.  Did you type what I gave you?
then she can;t have changed her home dir to rachel
oh I see.  Sorry for the confusion.  You want usermod then.
usermod -d /home/rachael rachael
no, just log in again
ask her to type: ls /home       and see what her home dir is actually called
I don't understand.  /home/rachael exists but usermod is saying it doesn't?
must have mistyped it
you're welcome
no
You need the alternate CD to upgrade without an internet connection, otherwise use the command do-release-upgrade.  Alternatively, do a fresh install with a live CD
you can upgrade from within jaunty
with the ISO I have?
no
because of the way live-bootable CDs work
